intro: Orchis maculata var. sacciferoides, commonly known as the spotted orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces a tall, flowering stem that bears a dense spike of violet or purple flowers with distinctive dark spots. Its roots are fibrous and adapted for anchoring in moist, calcareous soils. This orchid is pollinated primarily by bees and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
